section.title: What is onCourse cloud?
section.para: onCourse cloud is a hosted version of the onCourse client and server application that ish manage and maintain on your behalf. It is the same software and the same user interface as the locally installed client and server onCourse application.
The benefits of a cloud hosted solution include:

listitem.para: Hosting of your onCourse server in an enterprise grade data centre. Your server will remain accessible throughout local power failures and internet outages, as inside the data centre there are redundant internet links and generator back up power. If your primary office loses power or internet, remote access to your onCourse server is still available from other sites.

Management of your onCourse server. ish supply and manage the physical infrastructure that hosts your server, provide offsite backups and manage the software upgrade process for you when new versions are released. You do not need to engage your IT support company for any onCourse related issues or assistance as you may with a locally managed version.

Java Web Start for user application access. No software to install or maintain - one URL for all your team, and Java takes care of the rest. The software looks and behaves the same as the locally installed version - you aren't restricted to operating inside an internet browser window like some SaaS (Software as a Service) applications.
No need to update and install new client software when your server is upgraded. New versions of the onCourse client software are applied automatically when your staff login via Java Web Start.

Staff access to onCourse from anywhere with internet access. Home, remote training venues, other offices - there is no need for you to set up and manage VPNs or software installation on multiple machines. Access is to onCourse is secure from any venue and encrypted with a SSL certificate.

A unique database instance for your training organisation. Every onCourse cloud customer has their own mySQL instance of the onCourse server application running. This means we can upgrade your software when you agree for us to do so, and your data is not locked into our solution - your database can be handed over to you for self management at any time should you choose to leave the ish Cloud for a locally managed onCourse option, or if you choose to stop using onCourse altogether.

section.title: The onCourse Cloud Demo
section.para: If you would like to trial the onCourse cloud hosted application you can find it at https://www.ish.com.au/oncourse/cloud/demo/

This demo is designed for people who wish to explore the onCourse user interface and features and give onCourse a test run to see if it is the right solution for use in their training organisation. Existing users who want to see the difference in performance between their locally hosted onCourse application and a cloud hosted onCourse, or who wish to test out new features before their next upgrade are also welcome to access the demo.
The demo contains sample data that is refreshed weekly, and which is shared between all current demo users. This demo database is not designed for users to enter real classes, students or enrolments.
The onCourse Demo has a pre-filled user name and password. Just click 'login' to access it.

section.title: Running the onCourse client via Java Web Start
section.para: If you are running the onCourse cloud demo, or trying to reach your training organisation's onCourse cloud instance, you will do this via Java Web Start.

example.title: How to access the onCourse Cloud

listitem.para: Open a web browser and go to the URL provided by ish. It will look like https://www.ish.com.au/oncourse/cloud/your_training_organisation

caption.para: This is the URL for the onCourse demo. Demo will be replaced by your training organisation name

listitem.para: Nothing will load in the browser window, but a pop up will appear asking you to Open with Java Web Start (default) or Save the file. Select Open with Java Web Start. You may choose to tick the 'do this automatically' option to skip this step next time.

caption.para: This window will open when you go to the URL

listitem.para: The first time you run onCourse, or after an upgrade to the onCourse server has taken place, a new window may display notifying you that the application is being downloaded. This may take a few minutes.

caption.para: The onCourse application is downloading for the first time. Be patient!

listitem.para: Once the download is complete, or if no download is required, onCourse will load to the login window. Enter your login name and password as supplied by ish and select login.

caption.para: In the onCourse demo, the login name and password is already filled in. For your own cloud hosted instance, use the login name and password provided to you from ish.

listitem.para: After you successfully login, onCourse will load to the normal splash screen. Proceed to use onCourse as normal, or if this is your first time in the software, explore the user and interface and press all the buttons to see what they do!

caption.para: If you make it to this screen you have logged in successfully. Well done!

section.title: Trouble Shooting Java Web Start

para.emphasis: Q: In the first window, I don't have the option available open with 'Java Web Start'

section.para: A: Your computer may not have Java installed, or the latest version of Java. The onCourse URL should prompt you to download the latest version of Java, which you can do manually at any time from http://www.java.com/en/

para.emphasis: Q: After going to the URL, my browser has given me a security warning. What do I do?

section.para: A: Seeing this window (or not) depends on the security settings of your browser. If you choose to 'trust' the certificate, you shouldn't see this warning again. If you don't 'trust' the certificate, you won't be able to proceed with accessing the onCourse application.

para.emphasis: Q: When I try to log in, the window shakes and gives me an Authentication Error.

section.para: A: This means your login name or password is wrong. Try typing it in again and login again. If the problem persists, contact ish.

para.emphasis: Q: When I try to log in, the window shows a message 'The server could not be contacted".

section.para: A: If it is your first time accessing onCourse, this may mean that your local network settings are blocking the traffic between the onCourse client and server. Check with your IT staff that SSL traffic over port 6003 is enabled.

For users who have logged in successfully before, but are now seeing this error, this may mean the hosted cloud server is down for maintenance (you will have received notification). Please contact ish.
